question.title: Hibernate doesn't recognize reverse engineering strategy file
question.body:
in my Java Spring Boot project I generate entities using hibernate-tools-maven plugin. I need to customize some entities so I defined my strategy in a certain class and according with official plugin documentation I imported it inside the pom, but at runtime it throws this error:

Execution default-cli of goal org.hibernate.tool:hibernate-tools-maven:6.4.4.Final:hbm2java failed: An exporter of class 'project.api.domain.customstrategy.CustomStrategy' could not be created.

In debug mode I found out that this is due to the ClassNotFound exception.

This is my pom configuration for reveng strategy:

<revengStrategy>project.api.domain.customstrategy.CustomStrategy</revengStrategy>

According to the doc, the tag < revengStrategy > must contain:

The class name of the reverse engineering strategy to use. Extend the DefaultReverseEngineeringStrategy and override the corresponding methods, e.g. to adapt the generate class names or to provide custom type mappings.

It seems that it doesn't recognize the class, but I don't understand why. Any suggestions?

Thanks.
